data.title: Charming Facility -- Delightful Shows
data.text: The crowd tends to be older and always responds very favorably to the shows.  We have been multiple times and are always pleased we went to this charming intimate theatre.  The casts are talented, provide top notch singing, good clean humor, and a pleasant setting.  The sets for the show are very attractive and well done, as are the costumes.  Parking seems to be more than adequate.  There's a lot to like here!

data.title: Home town jewel
data.text: by sponsoring local talent, the Chestnut Fine Arts Center has a surprisingly excellent cast in all of it's productions.  It has an intimate setting which helps with the accoustics.  Not able to do bigger productions, but that's ok.

data.title: I think it just gets better & better!
data.text: Was pleased to take a motorcoach group here to see "I Do! I Do"....which might be my new favorite show I've seen here...and that is saying plenty because I have seen several good shows here.  This is not a large theater and to me, that is part of what I love about it!  Always nice to be welcomed and bid good-bye by the owner of the theater.

data.title: I Do, I Do
data.text: I liked it, I liked it!  Very well done.  This is a two person play-along with the piano player who is the theater owner.  It was fun evening to see a romantic comedy.  I am always impressed with how sparkling clean everything is and especially the restrooms.

data.title: Great entertainment for a fair price!
data.text:
We had friends visiting from out of town. Not having any idea what they might like to do. We came up with a night out at the Chestnut fine arts theater. Everyone had a good time and the performers at the chestnut fine arts Center were excellent. 
I can not recommend the chestnut Fine arts theater enough. Worth the time and a great way to spend an evening.

data.title: An intimate setting for shows
data.text: This is great local theatre with professionals who love what they are doing. The average age tends to be older, however, I love going there. Parking is easy and I like the smaller venue.

data.title: More than Just Local Theater
data.text: We liked the productions so much we bought season tickets.  This is not like a cold theater but more like you have been invited into their parlor.  We saw Shine on Harvest Moon and enjoyed the actors/singers plus the set and the music, what more could you ask for?

data.title: Excellent night on the town
data.text: We have seen a number of productions here over the last couple of years.  All were excellent.  The theater seats maybe 150 people.  Not a bad seat in the house.  Some productions allow for audience participation.  Production are G rated.  The ones that we have seen were all musicals or musical reviews.  Performers are very professional.  Staff is friendly.  Audience tends to older folks and families.  We would highly recommend it for anyone who enjoys good musicals.

data.title: What a Wonderful Surprise
data.text: Went to see the play "Route 66" great musical and we found ourselves singing along to most of the songs.  The actors/singers were wonderful and the band was super, especially for just a three piece combo.  Theater is on the smaller side which makes it very intimate.  Being on the smaller side it was easy to see the actors facial expressions.  The lobby, restrooms, and snack area are wonderfully decorated. When we got ready to leave the owner shook everyone's hand and thanked them for coming.  It was a great experience.

data.title: Top Notch Entertainment!
data.text: Their talent is beyond the expected at this theater.  This is more than just a local talent show.  We enjoy the musicals presented here in a smaller setting. When entering and leaving the theater, we are greeted by Brad Zimmerman, the owner and participant.  We have such a wonderful evening out.  "The best kept secret in Olathe!"

data.title: Local talent show in Olathe
data.text: While a bit crowded, the Chestnut is a unique venue with the owner participating in the shows. Most shows have a theme such as old time music or patriotic features.

data.title: Such a delightful gem...
data.text: Have taken motorcoach groups here on several occassions.  It is a small intimate theater...and that is what makes it so charming.  Well..that and the excellent performances they always have on stage.  Have never seen a bad show here and it seems like each one is better than the last one....it just keeps getting better and better!
